channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China's state-owned tobacco behemoth is booming, defying global trends and anti-smoking efforts
item.description: Powered by "the biggest tobacco company most people have never heard of," China is bucking global smoking trends as cigarette sales surge in the country.

item.title: Bitcoin is closing in on $90,000 for the first time ever
item.description: Bitcoin was trading just shy of $90,000 Monday night after it blasted through the $80,000 level over the weekend.

item.title: European Google rivals partner on search engine infrastructure to counter Big Tech
item.description: Ecosia and Qwant are partnering to build a European search index and reduce their dependence on U.S. Big Tech firms.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Better to stay prudent than bask in the postelection afterglow
item.description: It remains to be seen if the postelection market rally will fizzle out once the initial euphoria wears off, or portends a longer-term phenomenon.

item.title: Trump tariff threat looms large on several Asian countries — not just China — says Goldman Sachs
item.description: Donald Trump's recent victory is likely to see looming tariffs on China — but it may not be the only country subject to tariffs, according to Goldman Sachs.

item.title: This Australian quit her job at 24 and started a business out of her parents' garage—now, it brings in over $100 million a year
item.description: Jane Lu is the founder and CEO of online fashion retailer Showpo. Today, the business brings in over $100 million a year.

item.title: American interest in moving abroad skyrockets after Trump's win — here's how many would actually leave
item.description: Google Trends showed searches related to "leaving the country" and "how to move to …" spiked following the news that Donald Trump is returning to the White House.

item.title: Tesla shares pop 9% as postelection rally continues
item.description: Tesla shares popped on Monday, continuing to ride a postelection rally as President-elect Donald Trump begins to set up his presidential cabinet.

item.title: FTX sues crypto exchange Binance and its former CEO Zhao for $1.8 billion
item.description: The litigation marks the latest escalation of tensions between two of the biggest names in crypto, after the meteoric collapse of FTX rocked the market.

item.title: Trump's 'border czar' could have more power, fewer hurdles on deportation policy
item.description: Tom Homan, President-elect Donald Trump's "border czar," has a post that does not need Senate approval and could have less oversight by Congress, experts say.

item.title: Europe could try to stop — or get around — damaging Trump tariffs
item.description: Donald Trump's U.S. election win has left Europe scrabbling to work out how it will be able to contain — or counter — probable tariffs on its exports to the U.S.

item.title: Mattel pulls thousands of 'Wicked' dolls off shelves after printing adult web address on packaging
item.description: Target, Walmart and Amazon had removed the line of "Wicked" dolls from their online storefronts as of midday Monday, as had Best Buy, Barnes & Noble and Macy's.

item.title: Silicon Valley's General Catalyst makes first investment into Saudi Arabia through fintech Lean Technologies
item.description: Saudi Arabia's fintech startups have raised over $1.84 billion in venture capital investments since 2018, according to the kingdom's SME authority.

item.title: What's behind Salesforce's record highs — plus, a possible stock to buy after this week's earnings
item.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

item.title: The iShares Bitcoin ETF is now bigger than its gold counterpart following rush into crypto on Trump win
item.description: The iShares Bitcoin ETF has already surpassed $30 billion in assets in less than a year on the market.

item.title: China’s push for more babies lacks real incentives as demographic crisis deepens, analysts say
item.description: China's efforts to bolster the birth rate have yet to address the core reasons for their rapid decline, analysts said.

item.title: Singapore Airlines shares fall 6% as profit nearly halves amid intensifying competition
item.description: The fall in profits was due to "increased capacity and stronger competition in key markets," the airline said.

item.title: What Trump's mass deportation plan would mean for immigrant workers and the economy
item.description: President-Elect Donald Trump says his mass deportation plan will go ahead. Hiring firms and labor economists have begun to weigh the damage.

item.title: Over $2.8 billion bet on bitcoin topping $90,000 as it hits all-time high
item.description: Bitcoin hit a new record high as futures premiums soared, in a clear sign that investors believe the record-run will continue.

item.title: Fed's Kashkari says Trump tariffs could reheat inflation if they provoke global trade 'tit for tat'
item.description: Donald Trump unleashed China tariffs during his first term that essentially sparked a trade war after the country retaliated with its own U.S. import taxes

item.title: ‘Two-stocks’ are better than one? Repacking ‘pair trades'
item.description: How two-stock ETFs could transform pair trading for investors.

item.title: Painting the town pink and green: 'Wicked' takes over retail ahead of theatrical debut
item.description: Universal's "Wicked" is drumming up buzz ahead of its Nov. 22 release with hundreds of merchandise offerings from dozens of retail partners.

item.title: To influence people, make 3 simple changes to how you talk, says executive coach: Success 'depends on your ability to persuade'
item.description: "The ability to influence others can set you up for success" at work, says Melody Wilding, so that you can advance more easily and have more of an impact.

item.title: Top German business leader recalls his days working with Trump: 'His administration was extremely receptive'
item.description: It is uncertain what Donald Trump's second presidency will look like, but his first administration was highly responsive to business issues, Joe Kaeser said.

item.title: 5 in-demand low-stress jobs — they all pay over $100,000 and help the environment
item.description: Many low-stress, high-paying jobs are found in the sustainability sector.

item.title: How to say 'no' when family and friends ask to borrow money, from a financial therapist
item.description: Here's one way to set financial boundaries with friends or family members and how to manage guilt when you need to say no, according to a financial therapist.

item.title: 'It's gross, it's unprofessional': Some LinkedIn users are being put off the platform by unsolicited flirtatious DMs
item.description: A LinkedIn spokesperson told CNBC Make It that the platform — which was launched in 2003 and now has over 1 billion members globally — defines itself as a "professional community."

item.title: China announces $1.4 trillion package over five years to tackle local governments' 'hidden' debt
item.description: Authorities in Beijing have ramped up stimulus announcements since late September in an effort to bolster its flagging economy.

item.title: ChatGPT rejected more than 250,000 image generations of presidential candidates prior to Election Day
item.description: OpenAI estimates that ChatGPT rejected more than 250,000 requests to generate images of the 2024 U.S. presidential candidates in the lead up to Election Day.

item.title: Europe cannot finance Ukraine war if Trump pulls U.S. out of the conflict, Hungary's Orban warns
item.description: Ukraine has historically depended on foreign humanitarian and military aid to resist Russia's two-year invasion, with the U.S. and the EU providing the lion's share of this assistance.
